comments.body:
Hi Reynold,
Progress is a software vendor. They are/will be offering a JDBC driver for Cassandra.
Thanks,
Christian

> Am 26.11.2015 um 20:10 schrieb Reynold Xin notifications@github.com:
> 
> In sql/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/jdbc/ProgressCassandraDialect.scala:

comments.body: Are there other Cassandra jdbc drivers and is this the primary one people use? I'm thinking we should just drop "Progress" here if this is the primary driver people use.

comments.body: Yes, there is a bunch of other Cassandra JDBC drivers out there. Progress is one of them. But seen that the Cassandra SQL syntax mandates the list of column names in the INSERT statement, it is likely that other drivers will require the same syntax. So I will remove "Progress" from the class name.
